document.docTitle: Siemaszkoa ptenidii I. I. Tav. & T. Majewski

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Unitat de Botànica, Departament de Biologia Animal, de Biologia Vegetal i d’Ecologia, Facultat de Biociències, Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona, 08193 Cerdanyola del Vallès (Barcelona), Spain.
Natural History Museum of Denmark (Zoological Museum), University of Copenhagen, Universitetsparken 15, 2100 København Ø, Denmark.

figureCitation.captionText: Fig. 13. Siemaszkoa spp. A–C. S. ptenidii (Scheloske) I.I.Tav. & T.Majewski. Mature thalli showing protruding lip in A (*), and a trichogyne stump in B (arrow). Thallus in B has developed two mature perithecia. – D–G. S. ramificans T.Majewski.D. Mature thallus showing cells of the base of the appendage typically inflated (*). E–F. Immature thalli showing antheridia (arrows). G. Mature thallus. Scale bars: A, D = 20 µm; B–C, E–G = 50 µm. Photographs from slides ZMUC C-F-123285 (A), ZMUC C-F-123972 (B), ZMUC C-F-123227 (C), ZMUC C-F-122719 (D), ZMUC C-F-122797 (E–F), ZMUC C-F-124322 (G).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Mycotaxon 3: 204 ( Tavares & Majewski 1976 )
. – Basionym :
Misgomyces ptenidii Scheloske, Parasitologische Schriftenreihe
19: 135 ( Scheloske 1969 )
[MB#334359]. –

materialsCitation.collectedFrom: In einzelnen Exemplaren auf Halsschild und Elytren von Ptenidium sp.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type : “
In einzelnen Exemplaren auf Halsschild und Elytren von
Ptenidium sp.
(
Pt. fuscicorne
?) (Col. Ptiliidae ). – Die Funde stammen aus dem Gesiebe (Bodenstreu) aus Erlenbruchwäldern bei Schwand/Nürnberg und aus Genist an Weihern bei Dechsendorf/Erlangen. Deutschland. Holotypus Abb. 36”. [ Germany ]

subSubSection.paragraph: Receptacle consisting of 5–9 superposed cells (cell I included). Appendage unbranched, seeming like a prolongation of the receptacle axis. Antheridia unknown. Perithecium narrow and elongate, lateral to the thallial axis. Perithecial apex asymmetric, showing a protruding lip ( Fig. 13A , *). [Detailed descriptions: Majewski 1991 , 1994b ]

Only known from Germany ( type ), Poland ( Majewski 1973c ), and Belgium (
De Kesel et al. 2020
). Occurs on
Ptenidium
(Col. Ptiliidae ).

DENMARK –
Sydsjaelland (SZ)
• Praestø ; 55°6.913′ N , 12°2.035′ E ; UB11;
25 Apr. 2019
;
JP 1431
; JP det.; ZMUC C-F-123978
.

DENMARK –
Lolland, Falster, Møn (LFM)
• Nyord ; 55°2.885′ N , 12°12.380′ E ; UB20;
27 Apr. 2013
;
JP 840
; JP det.; ZMUC C-F-123335
.

First record from Denmark . Sometimes coexists with
S. flexa
on the same host specimen. Although many immature thalli have been studied, we have not detected the presence of antheridia. A well-distinguished trichogyne stump may be seen on the outer side of the perithecium ( Fig. 13B , arrow), which suggests the existence of antheridia. Rarely, some thalli bear a second mature perithecium ( Fig. 13B ). Thalli from host underside show inflated receptacular cells with constricted septa ( Fig. 13B ).
